1.title: Singapore

episode of.title: The Making of a City (TV Series 2014– )

1.plot: Singapore is exploring subterranean living and clean alternatives to water and energy sources in order to meet the changing needs of a growing and evolving city.

2.title: Jilin

episode of.title: The Making of a City (TV Series 2014– )

2.plot: China, home to the most populous nation is rapidly developing. But in the face of a looming food crisis, China still needs to feed her massive population. And they are turning to a small city in Jilin Province as a solution to her problem.

3.title: Yangon

episode of.title: The Making of a City (TV Series 2014– )

3.plot: For many decades, Myanmar was left isolated from the rest of the world. Today, Yangon, Myanmar's former capital, is rebuilding itself to become a megacity by 2040. How will this city achieve its renaissance while preserving its uniqueness?

4.title: Guangzhou

episode of.title: The Making of a City (TV Series 2014– )

4.plot: In Guangzhou, a city driven by knowledge is on the rise in. Unlike any before seen in China, it's a timely venture now that knowledge is king in today's global economy. But intellectual property rights protection will be critical in their wage against the country's counterfeit problem.

5.title: Hai Phong

episode of.title: The Making of a City (TV Series 2014– )

5.plot: Vietnam's rapid development has marked it as the next Asian Tiger, and Hai Phong, her third largest city has an ambitious plan to transform itself into a world-class city and become an epicentre of economic growth.

6.title: Chengdu

episode of.title: The Making of a City (TV Series 2014– )

6.plot: Chengdu, capital of Sichuan, is thriving as it takes centre stage in developing China's West. But water and air pollution, and excessive energy consumption are constant reminders of the challenges Chengdu's residents must face. What will it take for Chengdu to become a green supercity by 2020?
